meta_description: The Currier Museum of Art is an art museum located in Manchester, New Hampshire, United States. Its permanent collection includes significant works by artists like Picasso, Matisse, Monet, O'Keeffe, Calder, John Singer Sargent, and Andrew Wyeth, among many others. The Currier owns and operates two house museums designed by the renowned architect Frank Lloyd Wright: the Zimmerman House and the Toufic H. Kalil House. The collection boasts over 15,000 objects, spanning various periods and mediums.
hours_text:
#### Visit The Museum

#### ​Discover exciting exhibitions, inviting community events, and a world-class collection.

Welcome to the Currier Museum of Art, where great works of art greet you like old friends and there’s always something new to learn, see, and do. Whether you’re from across the globe or around the corner, we’re glad you’re here!   

Your visit is your canvas.

[Admission & Hours](https://www.currier.org/visit-currier)

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

## Art is a space for all.

It is important to the Currier to make high-quality experiences in the arts accessible to all.
